intro: Moricandia arvensis var. pallida, commonly known as pale field罂粟, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, characterized by its showy, showy flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in fields, roadsides, and wastelands. Its leaves are lobed and often have a rough texture, while its flowers range from white to pale yellow. The species is noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
